title: Hard-coded path in Utilities/WigFileThread.py
body:
The definition for start_wig_writer() only works on systems with user apfejes!  

Consider using TMPDIR environment variable, or creating a tmp folder in the repository to dump temporary output to.  See here for a tip on how to keep the temporary data itself out of the git repo.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/115983/how-do-i-add-an-empty-directory-to-a-git-repository

``` python
def start_wig_writer(self):
        # spawn a pool of threads, and pass them queue instance
#        for i in range(1):
        self.f = open('/home/apfejes/temp/findwaves.wig', 'w')
...
```

title: Query page title link
body: On the query web interface, the "Epigenetics Databse - Query" title text points to http://kruncher.cmmt.ubc.ca:8880/dbaccess/

title: URI becomes too long with too many samples
body: Passing the colours for each sample is a major issue, if the number of samples becomes very large.  This could be fixed by holding on to session information, for instance, rather than passing it in the URI.

title: "Group by" field can not be assigned by a user inputting information.
body:
The group by field is currently manually maintained.  This should be altered through the web interface.

work is currently in progress on this issue.

title: Database takes up a disproportionally large space for methylation data.
body:
Shrink down the names of the fields in the methylation table.

eg b-value -> b
probeid -> pid
sampleid ->sid

title: Allow the use of compound group-by sets.
body: Currently, samples can only be grouped by single fields at a time, this should be modified to allow users to make compound groups, where a sample is split up my more than one field.

title: Genes are not consistently showing up
body: Sometimes the genes fail to show up - not sure why.  This needs to be investigated and fixed.

title: User Security/Authentication required
body: This must be implemented before the interface for sample metadata modification can be  enabled.

title: New button to disable gene tracks.
body: Adding a button to disable gene tracks would be easy - should be done.

title: hide data sets that are not in use
body: For the Pavlides implementation, the meta data is loaded for a lot of data sets, despite the fact that most data is not yet imported.  There should be a default "display" field for the ones in use, and set to false for the meta data not in use.

title: Groupby tissue for all data sets
body: Long a goal of this project, group by tissue across data set would be a Major step forward.

title: Gene search box shouldn't be case-specific
body: It doesn't find 'adh1b' but does 'ADH1B'. I don't think the case should be important when using symbols.

title: A message should be displayed when the gene search returns nothing.
body: When the search doesn't find the gene, it stays on the previous genomic location without any error message. It can be confusing.

title: Add MetaData editing functions
body: Users with sufficient security should be able to edit metadata for their samples

title: Write function for creating a table to export functions
body: Collaborators require a table format export for their data analysis.  JSON exports are not convenient for them.

title: Redirect after login is currently broken
body: For some reason, the next property isn't being carried through the login window.

title: Add filtering for groupby.
body: There should be better options to filter on variables available in the data sets.  Work out how to do this.

title: Selection of compound key disappears
body: When zooming in and out, the selected compound keys disappear

title: Compound group by fails if item is an integer.
body: Test compound group by failed if "age" was used, where age was an int.

title: Colours used in svg generation are not ideal
body:
Yellows, for instance, tend into grey.  They're hard to see. 

Tighten up the ranges of colours, and use more sets.

title: Please put in an option to get metadata back (including compound keys created) from database
Display Illumina CpG probe id info when you scroll over points
Generate Manhattan plots for data sets.
body: Mike's idea... test it out.

title: Indicate which probes have snps in cpgs and which have snps in probes.
body: Once this is done, it may be worth adding a filter for the interface.

title: Reorder the colour lists
body: Right now, all of the colour lists start with the darkest colours, and migrate to the lightest colours - but they should start with midrange colours and then start heading towards the darker and lighter colours at the same time.

title: Looking at more than one project at a time fails
body: Since the new structure was put in place, the results have to be retrieved by project, and not just in random order.  Fix this!  Probably in collectbetas()

title: Reorder the navigation boxes.
body:
Elodie suggested:

 "I think the gene query box should go in the upper panel with all the query stuff. "

title: Add more colours
body:
Elodie suggested:

"The colors are a bit limited. There are about 30 tissue types but only ~8 colors so there is a lot of tissues with the same color. "

Possibly this means we should reduce the palettes for each colour, but have more colours.

title: Change icon for SNPs in probe/cpg
body:
Elodie suggested:

"For your index showing SNPs, maybe you should use a triangle rather than circle since the data points are circles. It's a bit confusing. "

Squares may be the way to go..

title: Change wording on the right hand side
body:
Elodie suggested:

"I'm not sure Group index/index is the right terminology. Maybe legend? "
